access: The following regions have access to firearms: Alkenstar, Dongun Hold, Tian Xia, Vudra, Arcadia, Ustalav, the Shackles
markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Jezail](/Weapons.aspx?ID=203)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Concussive" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=401" />
<trait label="Fatal Aim d12" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=404" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 153 <sup>2.0</sup>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) All Pathfinder Society agents have access to all uncommon weapons, ammunition, and related items from Chapter 4_

**Access**  The following regions have access to firearms: Alkenstar, Dongun Hold, Tian Xia, Vudra, Arcadia, Ustalav, the Shackles

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 11 gp

**Damage** 1d8 P

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

**Range** 90 ft.

**Reload** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Ranged

**Category** Martial

**Group** [Firearm](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=16)
</row>

**Ammunition** [Firearm Ammunition (10 rounds)](/Weapons.aspx?ID=211)

</column>

---

Jezails are simple, efficient long guns developed in Casmaron that typically feature a custom stock and a flintlock firing mechanism. Though lacking the range and stopping power of an [arquebus](/Weapons.aspx?ID=195) or the raw force of a [harmona gun](/Weapons.aspx?ID=202), the jezail is an elegant, well-balanced weapon suitable for a variety of combat situations. It's even possible to tuck it under one arm to fire a less accurate attack that uses only one hand.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-16" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Weapons</title>
[Alicorn Trigger](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3214), [Boastful Hunter](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1178), [Iris of the Sky](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1182)
